definitions.example: He went to a far land.
He moved to the far end of the state. She remained at this end.

definitions.definition: Extreme, as measured from some central or neutral position.
definitions.example: They are on the far right on this issue.

definitions.definition: Extreme, as a difference in nature or quality.
Outside the currently selected segment in a segmented memory architecture.
definitions.example: far heap; far memory; far pointer

definitions.definition: To, from or over a great distance in space, time or other extent.
definitions.example: He built a time machine and travelled far into the future.

definitions.definition: Very much; by a great amount.
definitions.example: He was far richer than we'd thought.

definitions.definition: Spelt (a type of wheat, Triticum spelta), especially in the context of Roman use of it.
A litter of piglets; a farrow.
